column2: The turtle pantheon is based on the worship of a single god simply known as The Divine and his "vicars" - "Vares", who control different aspects of the world like skies, seas, nature and others. Since this religion combines both elements of monotheism and paganism, it's followers can easily coexist with various Earth religions

The Cult of Galapagos  is a terrifying religion, whose adherents worship and make human sacrifices to the relentless Vicar of War, Galapagos . In addition to the Vicar of War, they also worshipping other fallen ones that were condemed by others Vicars, such as Renneth, Vicar of Battle and daughter of Galapagos, and Berethan, Vicar of Shadows. Followers of traditional Turtle Pantheon despise Galapagos Cultists for their practices, and that feeling is mutual

The Triarchy, or VERIAL, is a religion based on the worship of three Gods-Triarchs: Lady Reanna, warrior-poet, patroness of military, Lord Al-Setep, patron of craft and knowledge and Lord Verios, patron of laws and diplomacy. The Triarchy is opposed by the evil god Shurdum, the ruler of the Cursed House and the lord of nightmares and diseases, who, according to legend, betrayed the Triarchy and killed Lord Naveruz, the herald of VERIAL

Followers of the True Triarchy claim that VERIAL are false gods, that replaced the True Triarchy of the ancient deities Alereth, Mali-Ra and Berat-Tashi. Moreover, they claim that it was VERIAL who killed Lord Naveruz, and not Shurdum, who fell into evil and madness because of the betrayal of the False Triarchy."

The religion of the Orca is based on the worship of the Creator God Marach, who, according to legend, carved the first orca from stone, and then taught the first seven forefathers of the orcas in language and crafts. In addition to Marach, the orcas also worship these seven forefathers, as well as many numerous ancestors who, according to their beliefs, help and guide them in their daily life. Evil tongues claim that the orca god Marach is in fact the elven Vare Aliur, which the orcas vehemently deny

The Cult of Knowledge cannot be considered a religion in the usual sense of the word. It is rather a philosophy aimed at comprehending and studying the world. Even "The One Omniscient" described in the texts of this "religion" is rather an incomprehensible ideal of a perfect being to strive for, rather than a deity. Nevertheless, like the followers of the Triarchy, the followers of the Cult of Knowledge fear and hate the evil god Shurdum...

The religion of the Nurutushians deviates from the materialism of the Cult of Knowledge towards blind faith in Nurutush, also known as "The Titanium God", a magical construct that helped the orcas move to another world, and its creator, Saint Karotech. Nurutushians believe that "The Titanium God" remaining in the dying world will soon join them in the new world and begin a new era of peace and prosperity

The Cult of Hazhut is a distorting mirror of the Cult of Knowledge, embodying the most negative traits of sharks - greed, lust for power, hatred of others. Slave labor, bloody sacrifices, ruthless exploitation and tyranny are the pillars of this religion, for such is the will of the Father of Darkness. At one time, the followers of this religion were ruthlessly exterminated by the followers of the Cult of Knowledge, but, apparently, not completely.

Rajatral'tar is a polytheistic religion based on the worship of numerous gods. The number of gods of this religion is huge, but several main gods stand out in it: the supreme god Rajatra, whose sphere is the sun and royal power, the goddess of war Serhejet, the god of fire and the desert Yajatra, the goddess of death Mafredejt, the goddess of fertility and rain Teferjerut and the goddess of knowledge Shejart. They all fight against the monstrous Apojri, the Great Serpent, who wants to devour the world

Wargadanism is a monotheistic religion based upon worshipping of a single warrior god - Wargadan. Wargadan originally was an Manatee tribe chief, whose truly name was long forgotten, who managed to unify the various Manatee tribes and build a mighty Manatee Empire. According to the Manatee legends, he did not die, but ascended to the eternal sky to rule not only the Manatee, but the spirits as well. Wargadan favour those brave warriors who show courage and strength on the battlefield and ascend them after their death to join his great army that wage war against various evil spirits and various foreign gods that seeks to destroy his followers.

A group of beliefs that existed before the advent of Vargadan, the Old Ways worshipping the forces of nature and the enless spirits, that exists in all things. And althrough the majority of Oruks have accepted the faith in Wargadan, there is still Oruks that deny his divinity and follows the Old Ways.

The followers of this religion worship and revere the first emperor of the Manatee Empire, Gorthauron Tar-Mairon, who was knowns to everyone as fearsome Dark Lord. The distant heirs of the Dark Lord or powerful rulers can claim this title and enjoy almost the same authority as the First Dark Lord.

The followers of this religion worship the worst enemy of the Dark Lord, the only worthy opponent who managed to challenge him - the Bright Lord. The distant heirs of the Bright Lord or powerful rulers can claim this title and enjoy almost the same authority as the First Bright Lord.
The gods of the Triarchy help and guide their people. To which of the Three Lords should I dedicate my prayers to become a better [Root.GetManWoman]?
A Lord Verios, the Divine Ruler!
A Lord Al-Setep, the Great Teacher!

The blessed saints of the Triarchy, canonized by the church, serve as examples of virtue for the faithful. What saint will serve as an example of virtue for me?
Saint Naveruz, The Herald of Gods!
Saint Resin, The Protector of Poor!
Created at the dawn of the civilization of the sharks, the Three Schools directs our society to a brighter future. Which of the Three Schools should I choose?
The School Nchar-Ashdaar, The Aspect of Destruction!
The School Nchuad-Ashdaar, The Aspect of Creation!
The School Nzar-Ashdaar, The Aspect of Preservation!
This character belongs to the School Nchar-Ashdaar. This philosophical school specializes in army management and warfare.
This character belongs to the School Nchuad-Ashdaar. This philosophical school specializes in architecture, construction and economics.
This character belongs to the School Nzar-Ashdaar. This philosophical school specializes in administration and diplomacy.
